WhatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most fascinating about this comic is not really the stories themselves, but the framing sequence. Max Faccioni appears to be a typical hardboiled detective in the mold of Sam Spade. His clients are a bit more colorful than most, but include the standard damsels in distress, shady mob types, and boxers who are being forced to take a dive. Zombies and hints of black magic spice things up in issue #1. 

What artist/writer GÃƒÂ©rard Goffaux aka Goff does, which is truly inventive, is to cast a framing story of a newspaperman in the 1980s first finding what appears to be MaxÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s body, then being approached by a gunman looking for research on Faccioni. Both incidents are used as a launching pad for telling the stories of MaxÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s illustrious past.
